thinking.disposable_income: Brighton Park is a working-class community with median household income around $43,000, significantly below Chicago's median. Many residents work in manufacturing and service sectors, with about 18% of families below poverty level
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Limited discretionary spending capacity due to lower income levels. Residents are price-sensitive to both transit fares and sales tax increases. Many households spend significant portion of income on basic necessities
thinking.accessibility: Good bus service along major arterials, access to Orange Line at Western and Kedzie stations. About 30% of households don't own cars. Many residents rely on public transit for work commutes to downtown and other areas
thinking.decision_rationale:
1. Prioritize lower transit fares due to income constraints and high transit dependency
2. Moderate sales tax preferred as very low tax reduces transit service quality
3. Support some driving fees to improve transit service while not overly burdening car-dependent households
4. Balance between travel time improvements and cost burden on residents
5. Selected policies that maintain reasonable transit service while keeping combined costs manageable for working families
